Message.Title: 1X Handily Beats S3 After Jelly Bean Update
Message.Msg: Folks, that's right -- It's One X (Tegra 3) not One X+ (Tegra 3+) that handily beats Galaxy S3 after Jelly Bean update, which Brings A Massive Increase In Performance. You can bet that One X+ leaves S3 in dust. The android phone torch has been firmly passed from S3 to One X+. Source: gforgamesDOTcom/gadgets/htc-one-x-jelly-bean-update-brings-massive-increase-performance-27028/

Message.Title: 32GB Nexus In Stock for Sale in US
Message.Msg: at google play, walmart, staples, B&H Photo, GameStop, J&R The assualt has started ahead of schedule. Expect iPad mini returns in mass. Which iDummies wanna buy an inferior iPad mini at a higher price? Anyone?

Topic.Title: FTC Staff Said to Formally Recommend Suing Google for Antitrust

Message.Msg: "Congress chose to permit all persons to sue to recover three times their actual damages every time they were injured in their business or property by an antitrust violation. By offering potential litigants the prospect of a recovery in three times the amount of their damages, Congress encouraged these persons to serve as "private attorneys general." -- The United States Supreme Court, Hawaii v. Standard Oil Co. of Cal., 405 U.S. 251, 262 (1972) Jeepers Best, Can you imagine --just for starters -- what THREE TIMES (3x) the total of Apple's and Microsoft's legal fees incurred to date in for fighting Google's antitrust behavor would amount to? That's actual damages, right? It sure is.

Topic.Title: 32GB Nexus In Stock for Sale in US
FTC Staff Said to Formally Recommend Suing Google for Antitrust

Message.Msg: "Can you imagine --just for starters -- what THREE TIMES (3x) the total of Apple's and Microsoft's legal fees incurred to date in for fighting Google's antitrust behavor would amount to? That's actual damages, right? It sure is." That would be like a Hat Trick, right? For Apple's Legal Beagles. First, they bill Astronomical Amounts for all of their multi-continent litigation against Google's antitrust behavior. And then they iCollect THREE TIMES (3x) their total legal fees from Google. On behalf of their aggrieved and damaged client -- Apple. "Light the Lamp, pardners."

Topic.Title: FTC Staff Said to Formally Recommend Suing Google for Antitrust

Message.Msg: Just another brick in the road that leads to the eventual shutdown of that fragmented, app-deprived, malware magnet Android operating system.

Topic.Title: FTC Staff Said to Formally Recommend Suing Google for Antitrust

Message.Msg: So Best? After the U.S. Federal Trade Commissions sues Google, and a judge finds them guilty of their bad antitrust behavior, and their aggrieved and damaged competitors Apple, Microsoft, Oracle et al. received Trebled damages from Google -- that android operating system isn't likely to be free anymore, right Best?. Google will have to charge for it. A lot. To recover their bazillions in fines. And if android is no longer free, the OEM cellphone makers aren't going to use it much because, well, it isn't free anymore. And without free android, nvidia's 00.90% market share for cellphone processors will plunge even lower. So indirectly, Google's bad antitrust behavor kills off the nvidia Tegra folly.

Topic.Title: Oh my. My my my. The Genuine Apple Mini is the #1 Best Seller. Already.

Message.Msg: A year from now, folks will just think of the Nexus as a fancy shampoo.

Topic.Title: Oh my. My my my. The Genuine Apple Mini is the #1 Best Seller. Already.

Message.Msg: So Best? Those plunging sales numbers forecast for the tegra-powered Nexus 7. 833,000 __ November 2012 397,000 __ December 2012 Is that due to the imminent arrival of that new high volume $99 Nexus 7 tablet? Which will use a China-based WonderMedia Technologies PRIZM WM8950 single-core 800 MHz Cortex-A9 CPU with Mali-400 Graphics Processing Unit -- instead of the current nvidia Tegra 3. Causing the aforementioned Precipitous Plunge in the sales of that old legacy Nexus 7 tablet. {CLINK clink clink clink, bink bink} The Tegra gets kicked to the curb. Again.
